name: Great Movie Quotes IV Quiz | Which Movie | 25 Questions

questions.text: "To be free, one must give up a part of oneself." -John Cameron Mitchell.
questions.explanation:
Hedwig and the Angry Inch.

	Spoken by Hedwig (John Cameron Mitchell). The story of a tenacious drag queen from East Berlin who comes to America to be a rock star. Starring: John Cameron Mitchell, Michael Pitt, and Miriam Shore.

questions.text: "I don't believe in hell. I believe in unemployment, but not hell." -Dustin Hoffman
questions.explanation:
Tootsie.

	Spoken by Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) to Jeff Slater (Bill Murray). The hilarious story of an out-of-work actor who resorts to dressing as a woman to get work. Starring: Dustin Hoffman, Jessica Lange, and Teri Garr.

questions.text: "I'd be the worst possible godfather. I'd probably drop her on her head at her Christening. I'd forget all her birthdays until she was 18. Then I'd take her out and get her drunk, and, let's face it, probably try to shag her." -Hugh Grant
questions.explanation:
About A Boy.

	Spoken by Will (Hugh Grant) to Christine (Sharon Small). The story of an amoral British chap who meets a young boy who changes his life. Starring: Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, and Rachel Weisz.

questions.text: "This sonic transducer, it is, I suppose, some kind of audio-vibratry-physio-molecular transport device?" -Jonathan Adams
questions.explanation:
Rocky Horror Picture Show.

	Spoken by Dr. Everett Scott (Jonathan Adams) to Dr. Frank-n-Furter (Tim Curry). The wacky hijinx of a young couple who get stranded at the home of a Transvestite from the Planet Transsexual. Starring: Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick, and Tim Curry.

questions.text: "It is a truth universally acknowledged that when one part of your life starts going okay, another falls spectacularly to pieces." -Renee Zellweger
questions.explanation:
Bridget Jones's Diary.

	Spoken by Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger). The heartwarming and humorous struggles of a flawed British woman and her attempts at happiness. Starring: Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth, and Hugh Grant.

questions.text: "You're a vegetarian? That's okay. I'll make lamb." -Andrea Martin
questions.explanation:
My Big Fat Greek Wedding.

	Spoken by Aunt Voula (Andrea Martin) to Ian Miller (John Corbett). Based on Nia Vardalos' one-woman show, this film tells the story of a Greek woman's massive and over-the-top wedding to a non-Greek. Starring: Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, and Andrea Martin.

questions.text: "I look handsome, I look smart! I am a walking work of art!" -Donny Osmond
questions.correct: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
questions.explanation:
Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

	Sung by Joseph (Donny Osmond). A filmed version of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit musical based on the Biblical story of a dreamer who overcomes hardship and comes out on top. Starring: Donny Osmond and Maria Friedman.

questions.text: "Fluff and fold, buddy. Soon as I make it really big, I'm going fluff and fold." -Emilio Estevez
questions.explanation:
St . Elmo's Fire

	Spoken by Kirby (Emilio Estevez) to Kevin (Andrew McCarthy). The quintessential Brat Pack movie, about seven 20-somethings who are dealing with love, career, and life in the 80's. Starring: Rob Lowe, Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Andrew McCarthy, Demi Moore, Ally Sheedy, and Mare Winningham.

questions.text: "Do you like my dress? It's awfully heavy." -Grace Kelly
questions.explanation:
High Society.

	Spoken by Tracy Lord (Grace Kelly) to C.K. Dexter-Haven (Bing Crosby). A musical remake of the 1940 film "The Philadelphia Story", this film tells the story of a debutante engaged to one man, but finding herself drawn to her ex-husband. Starring: Grace Kelly, Bing Crosby, and Frank Sinatra.

questions.text: "Never being happy isn't the same as being unhappy. Is it?" -Paul McCrane
questions.explanation:
Fame.

	Spoken by Montgomery McNeil (Paul McCrane) to Doris Finsecker (Maureen Teefy). The struggles of a group of students at a New York arts school to maintain their academic studies with their personal lives and show business aspirations. Starring: Irene Cara, Maureen Teefy, Paul McCrane, and Laura Dean.

questions.text: "Or I'll be a super-jet pilot, fly me high way out in the blue.  Then they'll see, I'm no shrinking violet. I got a lot of living to do!" -Bobby Rydell
questions.explanation:
Bye Bye Birdie.

	Sung by Hugo Peabody (Bobby Rydell) to Kim McAfee (Ann-Margret). The hilarious and fun-filled musical satirizing the U.S.A's obsession with Elvis Presley. Starring: Dick van Dyke, Janet Leigh, Ann-Margret, Bobby Rydell, and Paul Lynde.

questions.text: "So, you're great people to work with, this is a great present, and I wish I could squeeze you all into one pretty woman. And if you'd like to go to my office, I'll try." -Albert Brooks
questions.explanation:
Defending Your Life.

	Spoken by Daniel Miller (Albert Brooks) to his co-workers. The story of a dead man in a city-like afterlife and his attempt to prove that his life was worth something, in order to allow him to "move forward". Starring: Albert Brooks, Meryl Streep, and Rip Torn.

questions.text: "How fickle is woman!" -Clark Gable
questions.explanation:
Gone With The Wind.

	Spoken by Rhett Butler (Clark Gable) to Scarlett O'Hara (Vivien Leigh). The epic romance telling the story of a feisty young woman of the Old South and her life before, during, and after the Civil War. Starring: Vivien Leigh, Clark Gable, Leslie Howard, and Olivia de Havilland.

questions.text: "I am not deceitful! If I were, I should say I loved you!" -Anna Paquin
questions.explanation:
Jane Eyre.

	Spoken by Jane Eyre (Anna Paquin) to Mrs. Reed (Fiona Shaw). The story of a young governess who falls in love with her brooding and mysterious employer in Victorian England. Starring: Charlotte Gainsbourg, Anna Paquin, William Hurt, Elle MacPherson, and Joan Plowright.

questions.text: "Some people say that you have to forgive and forget. I don't know...I say forget about forgiving and just accept." -Minnie Driver
questions.explanation:
Grosse Pointe Blank.

	Spoken by Debi Newberry (Minnie Driver) to Martin Blank (John Cusack). The outlandish yarn about a hitman with a heart returning for his ten-year high school reunion. Starring: John Cusack, Minnie Driver, and Dan Akyroyd.

questions.text: "I enjoy being afraid of Russia. It's a harmless fear, but it makes America feel better and Russia gets an inflated sense of self-worth from our paranoia. How's that?" -Andrew McCarthy
questions.explanation:
St. Elmo's Fire

	Spoken by Kevin Dolenz (Andrew McCarthy) to Jules (Demi Moore).

questions.text: "One fine night, they leave the pool hall, heading for the dance at the armoury. Libertine men, and scarlet women, and ragtime! Shameless music that will grab your son, your daughter in the arms of a jungle animal instinct!" -Robert Preston
questions.explanation:
The Music Man.

	Sung by Professor Harold Hill (Robert Preston) to the citizens of River City. A musical about a con-man attempting to coerce the naive and simple citizens of an Iowa town into purchasing band uniforms and instruments for their youth. Starring: Robert Preston, Shirley Jones, Buddy Hackett, and Hermione Gingold.

questions.text: "It is not our abilities that tell us what we truly are. It is our choices." -Richard Harris
questions.correct: Harry Potter and The Chamber Of Secrets
questions.explanation:
Harry Potter and The Chamber Of Secrets.

	Spoken by Professor Albus Dumbledore (Richard Harris) to Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe). The second installment in the Harry Potter serial. In this film, Harry finds himself being accused of opening the dreaded Chamber of Secrets. Starring: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson, Richard Harris, Robbie Coltrane, and Dame Maggie Smith

questions.text: "You call this a happy family? Why'd we have to have all these kids for anyways?" -Jimmy Stewart
questions.explanation:
It's A Wonderful Life.

	Spoken by George Bailey (Jimmy Stewart) to Mary Bailey (Donna Reed). The classic Christmas tale of a man contemplating suicide who has a chance to see what the world would have been like without him. Starring: Jimmy Stewart, Donna Reed, Thomas Mitchell, Lionel Barrymore, and Henry Travers.

questions.text: "I ask for so little. Just fear me, love me, do as I say and I will be your slave." -David Bowie
options: Ziggy Stardust And The Spider From Mars
questions.explanation:
Labyrinth.

	Spoken by Jareth, King of the Goblins (David Bowie) to Sarah (Jennifer Connelly). The whimsical tale of a young girl drawn into a magical world of Jim Henson creatures. Starring: David Bowie and Jennifer Connelly.

questions.text: "When you borrow something and don't tell anyone, they call that stealing." -Alan Arkin
questions.explanation:
The Rocketeer.

	Spoken by Peevy Peabody (Alan Arkin) to Cliff Secord (Billy Campbell). The exciting adventures of a 1930s pilot who finds a rocket that allows him to fly, and uses it and his wits to foil the Nazis. Starring: Billy Campbell, Jennifer Connelly, Timothy Dalton, and Alan Arkin.

questions.text: "We're growing a strange crop of agnostics this year." -Gene Kelly
questions.explanation:
Inherit The Wind.

	Spoken by E.K. Hornsbeck (Gene Kelly) to Henry Drummond (Spencer Tracy). A court drama based on the Scopes monkey trial, addressing every human's right to ask "why". Starring: Spencer Tracy, Gene Kelly, Frederic March, and Dick York.

questions.text: "Armani don't make polyester." -Martin Short
questions.explanation:
Father Of The Bride.

	Spoken by Franck Eggelhofer (Martin Short) to George Banks (Steve Martin). The story of a frantic father-in-law to be who finds he is having trouble letting go of his soon-to-be-wed daughter. Starring: Steve Martin, Diane Keaton, Kimberly Williams, and Martin Short.

questions.text: "The only people who make love all the time are liars." -Louis Jourdan
questions.explanation:
Gigi.

	Spoken by Gaston Lachaille (Louis Jourdan) to Gigi (Leslie Caron). The charming musical tale of a girl being groomed to be a courtesan, who finds love in the most unexpected place. Starring: Leslie Caron, Louis Jourdan, Maurice Chevalier, and Hermione Gingold.

questions.text: "Contrary to popular New York myth, the Times is not omniscient." -Jeremy Piven
questions.explanation:
Serendipity.

	Spoken by Dean Kansky (Jeremy Piven) to Jonathan Trager (John Cusack). The story of two people who meet one magical night, and rely on fate to bring them back together. Starring: John Cusack, Kate Beckinsale, Jeremy Piven, John Corbett, and Bridget Moynahan.
